content: What novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald explores themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change, social upheaval, and excess?

The novel you're referring to is "The Great Gatsby" by F. Scott Fitzgerald. Published in 1925, it is set on Long Island's North Shore and in New York City from spring to autumn of 1922. The story primarily revolves around the mysterious and wealthy Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan. Through the narrative, Fitzgerald delves into the decadence and excess of the Roaring Twenties, critiquing the American Dream and exploring themes of love, obsession, class, and the corruption of society during that era.
